problem: Calculate the area of a regular dodecagon (12-sided polygon) with a circumradius (radius of the circumscribed circle) of 8 cm.
solution: The area $A$ of a regular polygon with $n$ sides and circumradius $R$ can be calculated using the formula: $A = \frac{1}{2} \times n \times R^2 \times \sin(2\pi/n)$. For a dodecagon with $R = 8$, $n = 12$. Plugging in the values, $A = 0.5 \times 12 \times 64 \times \sin(2\pi/12) = 384 \times \sin(30^\circ) = 384 \times 0.5 = 192$ square cm. \(\boxed{192}\)
